cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest over the northern Yucatan Peninsula tonight, then northward across the Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast before accelerating NNE across the Southeast U.S. and exiting off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana to Mississippi coast (near Morgan City-MS/AL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch Intracoastal City LA to Navarre FL; Hurricane Watch Morgan City LA to MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Watch MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL and west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Tulum to Dzilam Mexico; Tropical Storm Warning south of Tulum to Punta Allen and west of Dzilam to Progreso (Yucatan)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle, then inland across AL-GA-SC and eventually the Mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy to windy conditions with gusts below 39 mph most likely
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast from Zeta
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches possible, locally higher, could produce minor urban or low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat inland across GA/SC as the core moves northeast; short-fuse disruptions to river traffic if heavy rain coincides with high tide
